verb.description: Make (someone) feel utterly dispirited or dejected.
examples: that first day at school depressed me

verb.description: Reduce the level or strength of activity in (something, especially an economic or biological system)
examples: fear of inflation in America depressed bond markets

verb.description: Push or pull (something) down into a lower position.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French depresser, from late Latin depressare, frequentative of deprimere press down.
